list_definition.definition: to film (part of a film etc) again.
the filming of part of a film again

list_ex_of_english: His army won significant victories and retook the capital.
Only three of his prizes were retaken, and he brought into port 543 prisoners and 120 cannon.
The budget and schedules of serials mandated retakes only in the most dire circumstances.
Retakes allowed obvious errors to be corrected in these productions.
Two tenants on the estate were imprisoned for contempt of court for retaking forcible possession of their holdings after they had been evicted for non-payment of rent.
The government dispatched a force of 1000 armed officers to maintain order, but it was unsuccessful in retaking control of the village.
Their lines held, and much of the lost ground was retaken.
The episodes were then recorded as live, a very common practice at the time, with very limited opportunities for retakes.
